required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Ropivacaine/Dexamethasone and 10% Lignocaine Injection in GPN Block for Intractable Cancer Pain
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison Between Ropivacaine/Dexamethasone and 10% Lignocaine Injection in Distal Glossopharyngeal Nerve Block for Intractable Cancer Pain- A Randomized Trial

lead_sponsor.agency: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

clinical_study.source: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

brief_summary.textblock: The study will compare the efficacy and safety of Ropivacaine/dexamethasone vs 10% lignocaine injection in distal glossopharyngeal nerve block for intractable cancer pain

primary_outcome.measure: Pain reduction on the basis of the Numeric rating scale (NRS).
primary_outcome.description: Pain reduction on the basis of the Numeric rating scale (NRS). From 0 to 10 (No pain to highest pain)

secondary_outcome.description: BPI scores will be used to assess the change in pain before and after treatment. (Likert scale of 0 to 10, where 0 is none to 10 is maximum)
WHO Quality of Life-BREF scores will be used to assess change in quality of life before and after treatment. (Likert scale of 0 to 5, where 0 is no interference to quality of life and 5 is maximum).

Number of Participants With Treatment Success at the End of Therapy as Measured by the Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC). A treatment success is defined as Much or Very Much Improved at the Week 4. The PGIC is a 7-point Likert Scale, ranging from very much worse to very much improved

Number of Participants With Treatment Success at the End of Therapy Based on Clinical Global Impression of Change (CGIC) . A treatment success is defined as Much or Very Much Improved at the Week 4. The PGIC is a 7-point Likert Scale, ranging from very much worse to very much improve.

secondary_outcome.measure: Analgesic requirement and rescue analgesic requirement
secondary_outcome.description: The number and dose of drugs before and after treatment will be assessed.

arm_group.description: 3ml of 0.75% ropivacaine and 1ml of 4mg/l dexamethasone will be injected.

intervention.description: Distal glossopharyngeal nerve in the neck will be blocked by using 0.75 % Ropivacaine/ 4mg/mL dexamethasone injection
Distal glossopharyngeal nerve in the neck will be blocked by using 10% lignocaine injection

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with proven carcinoma of the oropharynx and supraglottic larynx with estimated survival of 3 months or more.
- Pain lasting for at least 2 weeks with an average intensity of 5 or more on an 11-point numeric rating scale (NRS) refractory to a combination strong opioids and NSAIDS
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Local infection or skin ulceration at the puncture site
2. Local anaesthetic allergy
3. Psychiatric illness that affected cooperation.

overall_official.affiliation: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi

facility.name: All India Institute of Medical Sciences

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: All India Institute of Medical Sciences, New Delhi
